reviewText: made it 2 minutes before i bailed.
too many innuendos... couldn't make it very far in this extremely lame movie
The title says it all, and what's not great about that!

Nowadays, if you want to see an original comedy, you have to go the Indie route! The studio films are all formula, meaning if you've seen one, you've pretty much seen them all. This is very refreshing!
Really funny performances, silly ninja fun, and random nerdy jokes abound!
Very funny film with great performances! Definitely worth checking out!
Fun movie with lots of comic book and ninja nerd-ery! Check it out!
Awesome movie, super funny!
Fun, silly movie, with great comedic performances! Also has some geeky pop culture references.
Enjoyable indie comedy.
Terrific Indie! Give it a watch!

A highly creative, 'Scott Pilgrim-esque' office basic comedy... on a budget! Which is no bad thing and the filmmakers use highly creative methods to showcase their unique vision, animation and... erm, ninjas!! For the many of us that have to stare at a screen for hours on end and who's mind tends to wander. Great stuff.
Straight to youtube video ...
Made it to the part where they were drawing boobs on a memo board - 5 minutes? Horrible!
Movie was a little slow getting started but it got very, very funny!!
I experienced office ninja, with very low expectations. That said, I enjoyed it and give it a solid three stars.

I enjoyed this low budget, part-time movie maker guys' movie. A talented group of film nerds who seem to be having a great time creating this movie.  And very cool was the graphic novel type strips made special for this movie.

I'll forgive the Ninja and Kung Fu speak.  The Japanese Ninja and the Chinese Kung Fu... never the twain should meet.
What a waste of time, talk about a bad B movie
Funny, cool little movie
better than i thought it would be, not as great as it could have been.  if you're an office dweller you'll relate

I wasn't so sure about this one, but am glad I did watch it.  Obviously NOT an expensively made movie, it more than makes up for it by it's humor and substory (animated).  The animated part somewhat coincides with the real life story line.

They even add a bit to the credits that is not usually seen in end-movie credits, as well as a few add-on funny lines to actual required statements.
Very funny. We could all use an Office Ninja.
It was bad
That is all.
Worst B-Movie in a long time.....

When I heard about Office Ninja from writer and director Bin Lee, I needed to at least find out what it was! He was kind enough to send a review copy. We laughed so much! This is such a geek movie, y'all.

Here's the setup. Tomas (Jade Carter) is a programmer whose bow-tied boss is still using an overhead projector with those plastic sheets to run meetings. His co-worker Jett (Robb Padgett) is a jerk who steals Tomas's work and gets promoted to a position Tomas really wanted and kind of needs, considering his dad has just been seriously ill and there are bills to pay.

So clearly, the only way to resolve this is dress up like a ninja and run around his office spying on Jett, right? Tomas's goofball co-worker Raheem (Jose Rosete) and new hire Jessica (Jessica Mills) aren't sure what to think of the appearance of an office ninja... and neither is Tomas once he encounters another ninja. What?!

I have a special place in my heart for any creative project that people clearly work on from a place of love. This is one of those projects. The cast is obviously having such a good time with this preposterous story, especially the folks playing the more exaggerated characters. The look of glee on Todd Johnson's face as his boss character clicks back and forth on his new digital projector is priceless. Also, an impressive amount of action and physical comedy is crammed into the very small physical setting of a set of cubes and offices and the hallways between them! (One tackle in particular caught me completely off-guard and it was so funny because I was so surprised.)

One small fly in the ointment for me was Tomas and Raheem's continued sexual harassment of Jessica. Raheem's behavior towards Jessica is almost as bad as Jett's, and yet the film mostly gives him a pass because he's one of the Good Guys. Tomas isn't innocent either but we're supposed to see it as "he likes her." We wished they'd figured out another angle for the comedy they were going for.

This isn't a polished big-budget Hollywood comedy where every line is perfectly written... wait, big Hollywood movies aren't perfect either. But it's a bunch of fun, talented people getting together to make something entertaining. Especially if you're steeped in geek humor already.
Funny but cheesy
Flat humor, kinda boring
Eh....a student final project with a little production value.

On a scale of 1 to 10, this movie s*cked!!! No acting ability whatsoever; no directorial skills; didn't watch long enough to see if there was even a plot. Amazon needs to start pulling in some movies with a little more depth!
Like a lo-fi version "Office Space" lots of fun check it out!

An Office comedy with ninjas!!! I'm serious! lol. I really enjoyed this film. It was just what I needed after a hard day. I laughed and laughed. Take some time off and give it a go. You'll be glad you did. :)
I admit I'm a sucker for workplace office humor. This is a very clever take on the genre. Well done.
Don't watch
Somewhat boring and plain.
Silly.
Had some funny parts but overall makes no sense.
Low budget film making is the new punk rock. More power to these guys.
